Sentencas: In order to restrain the decomposition and conductivity degradation of perovskite-type conductive material in the presence of chromia, manganese oxide modification of lanthanum strontium cobaltite has been studied.
Titulo: Stability of manganese-oxide-modified lanthanum strontium cobaltite in the presence of chromia

Sentencas: La0.7Sr0.3CoO3-delta (LSC) and MnO2-modified LSC coatings are applied onto Ni-Cr alloy and exposed to long-term oxidation text to examine their chemical stability.
Titulo: Stability of manganese-oxide-modified lanthanum strontium cobaltite in the presence of chromia

Sentencas: In a LSC coating, chromium species migrating from the Ni-Cr alloy could induce the decomposition of LSC and produce SrCrO4 and Co-Cr spinel oxides.
Titulo: Stability of manganese-oxide-modified lanthanum strontium cobaltite in the presence of chromia

Sentencas: In contrast, in the MnO2-modified LSC, Sr is stable and the low-conductivity phase SrCrO4 phase is rarely seen even the coated alloy has gone through 1000 h of oxidation tests at 800 degrees C.
Titulo: Stability of manganese-oxide-modified lanthanum strontium cobaltite in the presence of chromia

Sentencas: It highlights that MnO2 modification could greatly improve the stability of LSC under Cr-rich conditions.
Titulo: Stability of manganese-oxide-modified lanthanum strontium cobaltite in the presence of chromia

Sentencas: The study of solid state reactions reveals that the influence of MnO2 is mainly due to the reaction between MnO2 and LSC, instead of the direct reaction between MnO2 and chromium oxides.
Titulo: Stability of manganese-oxide-modified lanthanum strontium cobaltite in the presence of chromia
